str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A hand.
And, even, also, namely.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Outmost, outer, external. Comparative of exo; exterior.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
And, even, also, namely.
A grinding or gnashing. From brucho; a grating.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tooth. Perhaps from the base of esthio; a 'tooth'.
